definition: white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera
tree trunk/main part of sth/to manage/to work/to do/capable/cadre/to kill (slang)/to fuck (vulgar)
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc

sentences.english: He likes alcohol, but only drinks white spirits.
sentences.chinese: 喝酒，而且只喝老白干儿。

sentences.english: The old man has the habit of drinking a little white wine before meals.
sentences.chinese: 老爷子就喜欢饭前喝一口白干儿。

definition: name of a famous Tang dynasty wine/same as 白酒[bai2 jiu3]
jug (earthenware with a big belly and a small opening)
to be appropriate to have with alcohol/to down one's drink
douzhi, fermented drink made from ground mung beans/soy milk
Shaoxing wine a.k.a. "yellow wine", traditional Chinese wine made from glutinous rice and wheat
